alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:05AM EDT until August 25 at 10:01AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Vermilion River Near Vermilion affecting Erie and Lorain Counties. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Vermilion River...including Vermilion...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Vermilion River Near Vermilion. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Lowland flooding will occur in Mill Hollow Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 10.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 07/11/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM EDT.
